comments.body:
The 'results'(a.k.a commands) are of format:
```json
  requests:
    - data: '{"openconfig-lldp:config": {"suppress-tlv-advertisement": [ "SYSTEM_CAPABILITIES", "PORT_DESCRIPTION", "MANAGEMENT_ADDRESS"], "hello-timer": 30}}'
      method: PUT
      path: /rest/restconf/data/openconfig-lldp:lldp/config
```

Can someone suggest how I can test for the `data` field in request, given it is in JSON format and has a list in it.
You should be able to get what you want with the `from_json` filter (https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_filters.html#filters-for-formatting-data)

Reason my compare test of `data` field was failing was due to the unordered items in  'suppress-tlv-advertisement' list.
I am considering doing a sort on the 'suppress-tlv-advertisement' list before adding the element to the request.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +25,29 @@        - "{{ deleted['requests'][0]['path'] == result['requests'][0]['path'] }}"
        - "{{ deleted['requests'][0]['data'] == result['requests'][0]['data'] }}"

  - name: Assert that the after dicts were correctly generated
    assert:
